item.title: Comment on Friday assorted links by Crusader
item.description:
7. “On the economy, Dems can talk about opportunity and jobs (which they need to do). But they never distanced themselves from the Silicon Valley and the global business elite.”

Whereas Trump’s won this race because he famously distanced himself from the Silicon Valley and business elite….

Daron seems to think to appeal to the “working class” you need to distance yourself from “elites”. If anything, much of the “working class” seems to admire and prefer the ‘strength and winning’ mentality and crowd and would rather associate with the elite than what Democrats are championing.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/friday-assorted-links-494.html?commentID=160832364

Votes: 82⬆ 2⬇

item.title: Comment on Friday assorted links by Rich Berger
item.description:
Reply to Crusader:

7. “On the economy, Dems can talk about opportunity and jobs (which they need to do). But they never distanced themselves from the Silicon Valley and the global business elite.”

Whereas Trump’s won this race because he famously distanced himself from the Silicon Valley and business elite….

Daron seems to think to appeal to the “working class” you need to distance yourself from “elites”. If anything, much of the “working class” seems to admire and prefer the ‘strength and winning’ mentality and crowd and would rather associate with the elite than what Democrats are championing.

This guy is a "Nobel Prize Winner"? His low quality lament is indistinguishable from the caterwauling emanating from dozens of left wing outlets.

It is delicious to see, hear and read the weeping and gnashing of teeth as the left loses its mind over Orange Hitler's beat down. I was talking to a guy at the gym who is a cop in a nearby city. He says he can breathe again and he feels saved. I suspect LEOs all over the country are feeling the same way.
